title: How to Make Gluten‐Free Pretzels

steps.headline: Add in the ingredients to a large bowl.
steps.description: Add in the flour, butter, yeast, sugar, salt, baking powder, xanthan gum, egg, and water.

steps.headline: Mix ingredients together until a firm dough is made.
steps.description: Mix the ingredients with your hand or with an electric mixture.

steps.headline: Knead the dough.
steps.description: After the dough is kneaded smoothly place the dough into a greased bowl.

steps.headline: Tightly cover the dough and allow it to rise.
Preheat oven to 420°F (215°C).
steps.description: Line the two baking pans with parchment paper or grease them lightly with oil or butter.

steps.headline: Boil 4 quarts of water in a large pot.
steps.description: After boiling the water place the dough into a floured surface and divide into twelve even pieces.

steps.headline: Cover the sections of dough then roll them into 12-14 ropes.
steps.description: Cross both of the ends of the ropes then fold it over to create the pretzel shape.

steps.headline: Place the uncooked pretzels onto the pans from earlier.
steps.description: Lay the pretzels with a gap between them so they don't get stuck together in the baking process.

steps.headline: Pour sugar and baking soda into boiling water wait until the water starts to foam up.
steps.description: Gently place the uncooked pretzels dough one at a time into the boiling water for 5 seconds.

steps.headline: Put the pretzels back onto the baking pan.
steps.description: Sprinkle some salt on top of the pretzels for extra flavour. Pop the pretzels into the oven for 18-20 minutes (soft pretzels) 25 minutes (chewy pretzels) or 35 minute for hard, crunchy pretzels.

steps.headline: Remove the pretzels from the oven when golden brown.
steps.description: Let the cool down for 10 minutes before eating.

text: Add in the ingredients to a large bowl. Add in the flour, butter, yeast, sugar, salt, baking powder, xanthan gum, egg, and water. Mix ingredients together until a firm dough is made. Mix the ingredients with your hand or with an electric mixture. Knead the dough. After the dough is kneaded smoothly place the dough into a greased bowl. Tightly cover the dough and allow it to rise.  Preheat oven to 420°F (215°C). Line the two baking pans with parchment paper or grease them lightly with oil or butter. Boil 4 quarts of water in a large pot. After boiling the water place the dough into a floured surface and divide into twelve even pieces. Cover the sections of dough then roll them into 12-14 ropes. Cross both of the ends of the ropes then fold it over to create the pretzel shape. Place the uncooked pretzels onto the pans from earlier. Lay the pretzels with a gap between them so they don't get stuck together in the baking process. Pour sugar and baking soda into boiling water wait until the water starts to foam up. Gently place the uncooked pretzels dough one at a time into the boiling water for 5 seconds. Put the pretzels back onto the baking pan. Sprinkle some salt on top of the pretzels for extra flavour. Pop the pretzels into the oven for 18-20 minutes (soft pretzels) 25 minutes (chewy pretzels) or 35 minute for hard, crunchy pretzels. Remove the pretzels from the oven when golden brown. Let the cool down for 10 minutes before eating.
